reviewText: First of all it's a very inexpensive lens so expectations were low to begin with.  However, since it's a camera lens it should at least be able to focus in order to take a picture.  Came packaged nice, had all the parts, made of aluminum and it had a bit of "white" corrosion on it like aluminum gets so I had to use some steel wool to remove it before I gave it to the person it was intended.  Being a gift also compounded the disappointment.  Next is the return process so hopefully that will go better than the first part.  I may even just skip that part as the time and money to return it may not be worth the $15 cost in the first place.  Very much on the fence in regard to that which is part of buying online, the risk of having to jump through hoops to return it rather than walking into a store and resolving the problem somewhat immediately and in person.  One star for it getting to me, one star for appearance and packaging.  No stars for functionality if it doesn't work, right?If it did work I also think it would be very difficult to keep it steady to get the picture.  I read that in other reviews and once I had it in my hand and even though I couldn't get it to focus enough to result in a good picture, I could see enough that it was evident something this small and zooming 12x would make it a challenge.
The camera came without directions, or helpful hints on how to really focus on differentItems! ALL the pictures are blurry!! Not satisfied at all. Wished I wouldn't have spent the money on this lens!
Great product, really zooms in and takes a great picture. Trippod could be slightly heavier duty but all in all, its a great deal.
summary: A must have fro great pics.

reviewText: I am very pleased with the phone we received.  It is a genuine Samsung S3.  I purchased this for my wife, she took it to the ATT store where they plugged in a sim card and set it up within 5 minutes.  No problems at all.  It has performed flawlessly even after being dropped on our tile floor. I even like some of the displays better than my S4 which is probably associated with the S3 operating system.  The price was in line with other sellers. Breed shipped the phone right away.I had read a number of reviews on this product advertised elsewhere on Amazon and was concerned about receiving a clone or refurbished phone as described by some other buyers (even from the same seller).  However, I think that reviews may get bundled under specific product names so I suggest you just be sure what is being advertised for sale by the specific seller.  This ad was for a new S3 SGH-I747 (US model) ATT phone and that is exactly what we received.
The Samsung Galazy S3 is one of the best phones I've ever used. I absolutely love the phone and the photo quality it has.
summary: As described and a great phone

I purchased the original Nook when Barnes and Noble started making them.  I remember being on the wait list for months to receive it.  I noticed that my rechargeable battery ( which is the original and is 4 years old) was no longer holding a charge as long as it used to.  Just like with all rechargeable batteries they die off too; at sometime.  So I went to Barnes and Noble to obtain the battery - which used to be carried in the store.  The informed me that the Nook 1st Editions were completely being phased out for the newer models and the batteries were no longer available.  I was told to search online if I wished to keep the Nook I had.  Well, its the best by far of any e-reader I have used or played with.  I am keeping  - hopefully for a long time to come.  Thank you for having the original battery in the original packaging.  I love it that it works and will still be able to use my Nook 1st edition for "many" more years.

The shinny coating is slivered and separating from alongside the edge of the cutout for the volume control, and, moreover, the hole for the volume control doesn't line up correctly, but instead overlaps the bottom of the volume rocker; in other words, the case doesn't even *fit*!! Do *not* get suckered by pretty and a designer name, and waste your money on this over-priced piece of crap!

The audio signal from this BT receiver is inferior to the Zehui Bt receiver.  I know because I own both receivers.  Zehui had no issue transmitting music with more bass, but with this unit, it sounded like I had turned the volume to the max and the speakers couldn't handle the bass.  The type of music that I listen to are not hip/pop, rock or rap which has a lot of bass.  I do have the phone BT audio volume turned to the max and likewise fairly loud for the car audio volume (probably because the audio signal is weak). But when I compare the two BT units back to back, the Zehui could handle the audio signal and this unit couldn't. On the other hand, I now use this BT unit with my home stereo system which has its own amplifier. If I lower the phone BT audio volume, it works okey.On a separate note, I had purchased this BT receiver trying to figure out why I couldn't get phone audio from my car speakers.  As it turned out (which I explained in my Zehui review), you need a BT receiver that has HFP or HSP profile not just A2DP! This BT unit only has A2DP so it will not transmit phone audio!
For the price, it is OK. Wasn't as user friendly as I had expected. Probably a problem with the "operating nut".

When I made the decision to spend $1593.75 (including shipping) on my charcoal Glass II Explorer last November, I had expectations for what I could use it for. Here is a report on what those were, what other uses I discovered, and how Glass fared in regard to each use.A better action video camera?I had high hopes for Google Glass to be a replacement for my $50 bullet camera with better battery life, better image quality (because of the wide-angle lense) and better operability (because I see what it records and can pause it etc).The verdict: Glass fails in this category. The battery life is even shorter (30 minutes tops with a full battery right off the charger). I can wear it under my aero-helmet, but not without feeling pressure. This is a no-go on even the shortest bike rides or runs. The low-light capability is not great, either, and on my night runs with a head light there is not much to see on the resulting video.It does not fit under or over ski goggles, and the clear or active shades do not replace goggles (too small and too much draft that will tear up eyes at higher speeds).An in-vehicle or dashboard camera?A camera that reliably and continuously records what happens around me when I drive would be great. Glass is promising, because it captures my field of view, including the rear view mirror, but it is not reliable and cannot record continuously. When plugged in, the battery life would be no issue, but there is currently no app that records continuously (and overwrites earlier clips when memory runs out). Also, the display is always on when it records video, which is bothersome at night.With a little bit of practice it is possible to wake up Glass and get into video recording mode in a matter of a few seconds, but that is not fast enough in unexpected situations.My verdict: I think that the device has potential in this category with the right software. Currently it is limited.A better run/ride tracker?I saw that Strava has Glass apps even before I placed my Glass order, and I uploaded my entire workout history from Garmin to Strava in anticipation of using their apps with Glass.The verdict: Glass fails in this category, but my reasoning requires explanation, because admittedly this is the fault of my Nexus 5 and not so much the fault of Glass. Glass relies on the GPS sensor of the phone, and the Strava app only works when the phone is paired. Unfortunately my Nexus 5s GPS sensor data appears to be very inaccurate. When I started a "Run" on Strava while walking the dog, it placed me some 50 yards away from the road that I was on. I will continue to depend on the good old Garmin 305 in the coming years.In addition to issue with GPS accuracy, I don't take Glass on runs because I sweat a lot from the head and both the power button and the bone-conduction speaker would be exposed and allow sweat (or rain water!) to enter the device.A better headset?A resounding no here. The bone conduction speaker vibrates and tickles behind my ear. Having longer conversations on Glass is uncomfortable. The sound quality is moderate at best, and many times there is some kind of mechanical obstruction that causes strong distortions, to a point where I cannot understand the other party. I keep my Glass clean and protected, so I am not sure what causes the distortion. Maybe a tiny dust particle is all it takes.The ear bud speaker that is now included with Glass is too cumbersome to deal with for me. Glass is already bulky and in the way when you take if off because you can't simply fold it and put it in your shirt pocket. Now having something dangling on a USB cord attached to Glass is a non-starter. I have not even taken the ear bud out of the box yet.A hands-free smart phone controller?Being able to control important features of your phone without actually having to look at it or even hold in your hand is a compelling feature. If you use Gmail and Hangouts exclusively, you are being well-served by Glass. You will be alerted by and can read instant messages. and respond to and write instant messages and emails by using the voice recognition that works pretty reliably for me.I don't seem to be able to create emails from scratch, only instant messages to one of up to 10 contacts. I do see emails in my Gmail inbox, though. They appear as a new slide in the timeline and I can respond to them without ever touching Glass. This is pretty cool.The verdict: Unfortunately, I use neither Gmail nor Hangouts, and I frankly don't get Hangouts. I cannot access emails on my company's Exchange server or my personal IMAP service from Glass, and while I have over 1,000 contacts on my phone, I only see 14 contacts on Glass. This pretty much renders Glass useless as a communication device.A better navigation device?I really like the way navigation works. I have one car with a built-in navigation system and will not use Glass there - it certainly does not compete with the Mercedes Comand System. In my other car I do not have a navigation system at all, and previously I had to meddle with the phone when I needed directions. This works so much better on Glass.My verdict: Navigation is definitely a compelling use of the product, in the car as well as on the bike or on foot (even though Google Maps lacks trail data). Based on some recent incidents that made national headlines, it appears that there is currently doubt among law enforcement officers whether using Glass while driving is legal and safe. I can attest that it can be surprising and distracting when Glass comes to live in full brightness during a night drive to alert you of an upcoming turn, but I don't find it all that different from having a GPS device in the car that is on all the time.A better music streaming device?With access to Google Music and completely hands-free operation through voice-activated searches, Glass offers yet another compelling use.My verdict: Exciting possibilities, but currently we have to compromise on either poor audio quality or complicated handling/wiring of ear buds. The mono ear bud that comes with Glass is, well, mono only; stereo ear buds are available for an extra $85, and my ears aren't made for ear bud-type headphones anyway. They tend to hurt and fall out, and the same is true for the ear bud that came with Glass. Overall, I am somewhat indifferent about Glass' current usefulness as a music streaming device.Other uses?Glassware can be installed from the phone or the computer. The current selection of applications that work with Glass is limited (I just counted 35), which I find surprising, given how long Glass has been available to the development community already.My verdict: The speed of adoption among application developers seems to be slow and the number of available applications is small. I am confident that this will change. Still, no more than a null-vote on other uses at this time.A mature and well-tested device?I run into odd and unexpected situations with Glass almost daily that require some tinkering to figure out. Examples?*The on-head detection is flakey and sometimes shuts off Glass unexpectedly. I figured this out myself and the chatter on the Explorer forums confirmed my diagnosis. I just disabled this feature entirely.*The "Ok Glass" command stopped working on the 3rd day. I had to do a factory reset to get it back.*When I did a factory reset, it took several attempts and an uninstall of the MyGlass app on the Nexus 5 before I was able to pair them again. Glass would just not get into pairing mode.*Currently, phone calls or navigation don't work while on a Wifi connection, even though I am paired and connected with the Nexus 5. There is no way to "disable" the wireless connection temporarily. You have to make Glass "Forget" the connection to make a call and then recreate it. The phone reports the Bluetooth profile "Phone Audio", not "Headset" as one would expect.*I am perpetually confused by what contacts I get to see on Glass. I understand that I can add up to 10 contacts from my phone that will show up on Glass as separate slides. So far I added 5 contacts. When I want to make a phone call, I am presented with 14 contact choices, though, the same people that appear in my Hangouts on Google. With half of them I have had no contact in years and I don't have the slightest idea how they ended up there.My overall verdict:The head-mounted display and its possibilities are exciting and an indication that this technology will become pervasive in the very near future. But Glass appears to still be an experimental device that does not excel in any particular discipline, comes with a high price tag, and that non-techie consumers will struggle with. The short battery life severely limits its practical use and spoils the fun.I no longer keep my Glass charged and use it maybe once a month. It still works as a conversation-starter. If you expect anything more than that, you will be disappointed.

reviewText: Upon receiving my PowerBear case, I initially had a good reaction to it's size, functionality, and how it felt in the hand.  Everything went downhill though when I tried to charge it.After trying three different micro USB cables, I eventually got the case to start charging by shoving one of them as far into the port as possible with quite a bit of force.  If I even touched the cable after putting it in the port, it would stop charging my case.  Since this case's input is 500mAh, charging took approximately 7 hours, give or take an hour.  After a whole night of charging (might I add the LED's on this thing are as bright as the sun, be prepared to flip it over if it's charging in your bedroom at night), I plugged my phone into the case the next day with about 1/4 of my phone's battery left.  My case's LED indicator went from four LED's to just one in a little over an hour, and it added about 7% of battery life to my phone.  Between the extremely finicky charging cable port, and it's lack of being able to hold a charge, I had to return this product.I would have given it one star since it really doesn't hold a charge or even charge for that matter, but I decided to add another for the design of the case although the kickstand is extremely flimsy and half of the time won't even hold up my phone.  Buyer beware, this is a hit-or-miss product if you get one with a working battery or not.

reviewText: The case itself is a very solid unit. It feels strong and is not too heavy. I actually think it is more comfortable to hold my S4 with this case on than without. The little kickstand seems flimsy, so I don't use it in fear that it will break off. The battery on this case will do about a 70% charge, they make cases with bigger batteries but those are also bulky and heavy. The battery is only rated at 500mAh, so it does take a while to charge the phone. You can charge the case and battery at the same time by switching on the power for the case while it is plugged in, but ONLY do this with a 500mA charger!! If you use the S4's stock 2A charger, it will get extremely hot, which can destroy the battery or possibly damage the phone. You can also connect the phone to your computer through USB while the case is on, you just have to turn on the battery with the power button. My only complaint is that the LED's are extremely bright. I like to lay in bed and read the news on my phone, and I have to turn the case off because the lights are blinding/distracting.Overall, it is a great product for the money, it is sturdy, comfortable, and best of all it gets me through the entire day of heavy phone use! The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is due to the super bright LED's, and the heat issue with some chargers.
summary: Works very well for the price

I have been using my PowerBear Samsung Galaxy S4 Battery Case for a couple weeks now.  While I was mostly pleased with the case design (it's attractive, sleek, provides a snug fit for the phone, and is lightweight), the battery performance has been disappointing.  When I've attempted to charge the phone in the case overnight (with the case turned on), the phone is still not fully charged some 7 hours later.  When I've relied on the case to recharge the battery on the go, recharging not only takes hours, but the extended battery runs out of juice before the charge is complete.  Typically, I can only get to 70% charge of my Galaxy S4, even having charged the case to 100% (as indicated by 4 blue lights on the LED panel).  Since a couple reviews alluded to the PowerBear's lackluster performance, I'm sorry I failed to heed those warnings in purchasing the item.  I had hoped to avoid spending what the Mophie battery case currently costs, but as is often the case--we get what we pay for.  Based on my experience with the PowerBear, I would not recommend this item.
summary: Mostly Disappointed by the PowerBear's Performance

No. Just no. I purchased and started using the PowerBear for my S4 just over a month ago and do not recommend this product. It takes forever to charge, when it is fully charged and you turn it on to give your phone a boost it'll either drain your phone battery or give your phone about a 20% boost before the PowerBear itself is dead. You can't charge your phone while it's in the PowerBear case because it will charge the PowerBear only while also magically sucking juice from your phone. It comes with an added feature of getting so blazingly hot while charging my phone or being charged itself that my phone actually powers itself down after giving me the hot battery warning. Also, the led power indicator lights are obnoxiously bright. Finally, the lovely return policy of "14-days from date of original purchase" gives you just enough time to  order and receive it in the mail (2-3 days), figure out how to use it because it comes with zero instructions (1 day), and then *just* enough time (7-10 days) to feel 100% confident that the product itself is a total fail and not a function of operator error, and then wah-lah: the 14 day return period is up. If this product were legit, they'd at least offer a 30-day return policy. So, for all these reasons and more, just no.

I have a couple of Ipods and I like to listen to them without headphones or earbuds sometime as I move about the house and this seemed like a good idea.First off, some ipod touches have a sound "speaker" at the bottom right and this will match up to the acoustic "horn" better than the older ipod touches which has sound coming through the 30 pin connector at the bottom of the ipod.Like old time hand crank record players of yesteryear horns can amplify sound, but they don't improve the already weak and "tinny" sound coming from the ipod.Boom line is that this is an inexpensive sound booster, but really only works well if you are in a quiet environment. Outside on the deck with ambient noise and the sound gets lost, but in a quiet office, it does boost the sound a little.Pros: no batteries required, and it's relatively inexpensive.Con: there are acoustic limitations to how loud or what it can do to boost the sound.
summary: Works, but don't expect room filling sound

reviewText: This cell phone car charger was purchased at a very inexpensive price, compared to the cost of an official Samsung charger. Now I know why. In less than 7 months, it no longer works. One of the metal spring clips is no longer taut, and doesn't allow the charger to make contact with the car's metal cigarette lighter's contacts. I've bought many car chargers and home chargers for cell phones before, at inexpensive prices. This is the first one that has given me a problem. I've read numerous reviews from people saying to avoid these "cheap chargers", while others swear by them. It's just like going to Atlantic City or Vegas; how much money you're willing to part with all depends on how much you can afford to lose.

The only downside:  like all cases of this type, the softness means that certain parts are a bit loose, like the left/right edges, and the thin part near the speaker/mic end.  That's just a tradeoff with the soft silicone.  If you just want need minimal protection from scratching the back/sides, and something to make the phone less slippery, this works great. This USB charger is cheap, but also very poor quality construction.  Immediately upon plugging it in, I heard a very soft, high-pitched whine, almost like a tiny fan coming on.  At first, I thought that's what it was, that this thing somehow needed active cooling.  It was so soft, it was practically inaudible unless the engine wasn't running.It worked fine charging both phones and tablets for about a week, then completely stopped working.  No lights, no annoying high-pitched whine anymore (so I guess that's a plus) but also NO POWER.I'd return it and demand a refund, but it's not worth my time for something so cheap, plus judging by other reviews, I'm not likely to get one.AVOID THIS PRODUCT. I tried with each to get it back together but it was impossible.There's a better, similar-looking device from Scosche that I bought when these failed. I bought 2 of these chargers... Previously I had bought a very similar charger but it had a metal back rather than the plastic and it would charge an iPad ok,... I thought that this was the same unit, but unfortunately it was not...Basically neither of the two most recent units would charge an iPad... I put an ammeter on it to see if it would produce the required 2.1A.. but it seemed to top out at about 1.5A on the iPad port and about 1.1A on the iPhone port.Highly disappointed ... I will try to find the chargers that work...UPDATED..... Upgraded from 1 star to 3 starsI retested it again..Source Power 14.4VThis time I used a 3' cable rather than the original 6' test cableUsing the 3' cable...The upper connection (which is labeled iPad) only produced 1.2A.BUT I was able to get 1.9A from the lower connection which was enough to charge an iPad Just barely enough to charge the iPad3... won't work with a 6' cable as the voltage drop is just that much more than the unit can handle and still produce enough power for an iPad3 Both units tested identically....I am not going to return them after all...but I will still look for the other models..

reviewText: Problem.  I have an Android Optimus Showtime phone that I use for GPS, Bluetooth, and music at the same time.  I would like the phone not to DIE during a Roadtrip.  I thought this charger would solve my problem.  It does NOT keep up with the current draw.  Most will tell you that to get access to the fast charging capability for the USB standard, the date pins (internal two) need to be shorted.  Now you can either buy a special cable (the sell it here) or you can open up this little bugger and solder them.  Being and engineer guess which one i did.  (Hint: I soldered them).  Now this definately did REDUCE my power drop on the battery, but did not eliminate it.  Note that Only one device was plugged in.  I have not thrown an ampmeter on it yet only cause i do not feel like cutting up a usb cable.  I did order the 24W ANKER USB charger from amazon to see how that performs.  This one I will repackage and give it to my brother for his b-day(hehehe)

I could only give this USB car charger 2 stars because although it worked fine for about 3 months, it subsequently died on me.Pros:-Has 2 USB ports for charging, one (the top) is 2.1 amps.  The bottom slot is lower, presumably 1 or 1.5 amps.-Fits well in my charging socket - holds tight.  I've had some that were loose in my charging socket.-Works well to charge my iPhone in the top slot and the bottom slot works with most Android phones, except the very high end ones.-Has a blue LED light to tell you it is on and ready to charge.-The USB sockets seem to be well made and tightly fit all my cables.-Pretty solid construction.-It cost less than $2.Cons:-It died on me after 3 months.I had really enjoyed using this USB charger.  It rapidly charged my iPhone and worked well with charging the phones of my family and friends.  The two slot design makes this design very handy; with a 1 slot design, no one else can charge their device unless I remove my cord.  Of course, after this charger died, I had to go back to the 1 slot design I was using before.After 3 months, I began to notice the LED light flickering.  It was less than a week later that is quit working permanently.  I'm not sure what the problem was - faulty wiring, bad design, I guess I'll never know.  I thought about getting another since they are so cheap, but then I thought better of it.  Maybe they are so cheap because they are simply disposable after a short period of time.For whatever reason, it died and I was forced to look for another 2 slot design - I haven't found one in my price range yet.
summary: Works Fine, But It Died On ME

reviewText: This is a great product, has two USB outputs and can charge two devices at the same time.This item was shipped from overseas and I got it in about 2 weeks, which is much faster than the estimated time.It doesn't get hot (as opposed to similar thing I got elsewhere) and I'm very happy with this.

This is a nice product.  I did a little research and this is the cheapest 2 prong high output charger I could find.  I just needed something to charge my ipad in the car and this turned out to be much better than that.Lets start off with the basics.  This charger has two ports, only one is the high voltage one that will charge your ipad(i think its 2 amps or something).  You have to make sure that you plug your ipad into the high voltage one or it will charge veryyyyy slowly.  Of the two ports one is in the middle and one is on top of that.  It is the top one that is the high output.  There is a little sticker that tells you this on the actual device but you wouldn't know its there unless someone told you(look closely youll find it).  Note to manufacturer, make that sticker in white or something, its almost impossible to read in black.As a little bonus this charger has a blue led that lights up the clear plastic when its plugged in which is nice because a simple glance will tell you whether its connected or not.  Another little bonus is that if you plug your iphone into the high output socket it will charge the entire battery in about an hour!  That's A++ in my book, especially if you use the GPS a lot which drains the iphone pretty fast.Overall I am very happy with this item.  So much so that I ordered three more to replace all my chargers... Who knows what else will charge faster with this thing.  Enjoy!

So do have some replacements on hand. At this price, no problem.Yes, they work with both my iPhone and iPad. After the first drop, the case already started to crack. The second time a piece broke off, and the case suddenly became useless and not flattering anymore. If you are extremely careful with your phone and you know you won't drop it, I would recommend the case because it looks great. The H700 sent to me will only stay in pairing mode for 1 second.  I am unable to pair my phone with the headset bc it doesn't stay in pairing mode long enough.  I own another H700 already and the packing of the H700 I ordered from this retailer is different from the H700 I already owned.  I am returning this H700 today.

When I first got this device, it worked fine.  Now there is more static with most of my calls.  I used to be able to walk away from my cell, but now I have to be close to it when using my earpiece or there's no reception otherwise.

Too late to help the previous reviewer, but I just found out that you can lock the H700 into pairing mode as follows:  With the headset off, press and hold the talk button until the purple light comes on.  Then open the boom and release the button.  The headset will now stay in pairing mode for as long as you like.ObReview:  I had an H500 before and hated it for reasons that I won't go into here because this is an H700 review.  I finally tried the H700 and mostly loved it.  I have a few problems with noise when it's not line-of-sight to the phone.  A friend has had no end of trouble getting hers to pair with her Treo.  It's easy to accidentally mute (by holding both volume buttons at the same time), causing people to think it's broken.But all in all, I love it.  They completely nailed the user interface.  My typical way to use it is to have it turned off and in my pocket.  When I get a phone call and realize it's going to be a long one, I reach for the H700, open the boom and put it on.  It typically connects with my phone and picks up the call by the time I have it on my ear.
summary: Here's how to fix the pairing problem

reviewText: This headset works great with my Treo 700P. It connects quickly, is sufficently loud enough, and people seem to be able to hear me with little or no problem. My only issue was that I thought it would be black all over, and it appears to be the normal H700 that everyone else is selling. I was happy enough with the performance not to let the color bother me.

reviewText: This is my first Bluetooth headset, and I personally love it. I've seen reviews where they say the mic rests on your cheek and I can see how it could. Fortunately my face is shaped just right for this.It was easy to set up and even easier to learn to use.Pros:Price: Down signifigantly from the MSRPSize: Small and light, you can easily forget you're using it.Volume: from what I understand this is a fallback in many BT headsets. This one is fine.Flip out boom mic: the on/off functionality of this is great.Battery life: I'm charging this every 2-3 days, without needing to, I love it.Cons:Maybe too light, "feels" gentle, I don't want to test the ruggedness of this as I like it too much to lose it.Overall: I love it, and would highly recommend it (as long as you don't encounter the mic problem some people run into (read a few reviews you'll see)

summary: They need to change the picture

reviewText: I was a little disappointed when I opend the package. It was not rubberized but more a cheap plastic cover that I do not think would hold up very long. Was hoping to use it for a special occasion but will probabley give it away.
This is a great item! The one and only thing I didn't like about this item was it made my phone feel heavier. Why I don't know but it did. It's also a little tricky to remove from your device.
At first I received the wrong item but the customer service was great. They sent me the correct product very fast and credited me for my inconvienience. Thanks. Great Job A+.
This is a great case... It fit my phone perfectly and I still use it from time to time. Would recommend
It's cute just cracks easy and hard to take off without throwing your phone against the wall! But great price
I have had this one on my phone since I purchased it and love the deco art style of it.  Saves my phone from damage.
This case arrived on time, and it looks the same way it does in the picture. It will stay on the phone, and protects it well.
Realy like this!! Very colorful as I had hoped.  It has a matte finish that makes it very easy to grip/hold without being slippery.  Great choice!
My husband wore out his OtterBox and I gave him mine.  This case has worked great for me and I get compliments all the time!

I recently purchased and received this case for my HTC EVO. After reading all of the bad reviews on this one, I still really liked the design so I figured I'd go ahead and order it, and also order another rubberized snap-on case, different design. When I got the cases, they were both beautiful, especially this one. The design looks exactly like in the picture and it wasn't broken like a lot of people are saying. It was in perfect condition and also fits the phone perfectly. But the case is not rubberized (neither one of them). In fact, there's barely much plastic to it at all....one drop and this case would be history. Would it protect the phone? Maybe. But no rubber at all...I was hoping to get a plastic case with a rubber coating, to provide some type of shock resistance in the event of a drop. But no can do. The title also says something about a faceplate? I don't know what that means but there was no "faceplate", just a case. But hey you get what you pay for. Rubberized hard cases are expensive, so it's silly to think you would find one for less than $5.00.
summary: Great!......but not rubberized. You get what you pay for.

reviewText: Really pretty case but the colors on this Evo phone case faded really quick especially on the back side of the cover...

Received this item very quickly. The design is even more vivid than expected. The cover is soft (rubberized) but durable. I have received many compliments. It was an excellent buy! I would recommend this to anyone wanting a "good look" for their phone.

I ordered this along with several other HTC Evo cases.  It's as nice as any other phone case I've bought and paid $20 or more for.  Once snapped on, it was near impossible to get off, but I think that was a good thing.  I've had other cases that would pop off if I dropped them.  I would say this is worth every cent.
The design doesnt have all the purple like it shows in the picture but still love it, slim nice fit
I drop my phone often and it has not broken at all. this is a great case. I recommend this to anyone.
I found this on Amazon right after I paid $20.00 for a phone cover at the mall. I purchased 2 different covers and love both of them. They were a great buy for the money.

Pretty, but not as bright and vivid as in the picture. NOT protective at all, this is just for looks, happy meal toys come sturdier than this. It will burst upon impact. With that being said...I am a girlie girl and I love having different colors and designs on my phone and that's what this is for.
summary: You get what you pay for...on that note

reviewText: My mom & i had the same phone case.Im kind of hard on my phone.I try not to drop it but it seems to happen alot.My mom is very protective of her phone(she rarely drops it.)But in this situation she had the case for a few weeks before it broke.It fell off of the desk & broke instantly.But i had it for a few months & dropped my phone a million times(falling on concrete & wooden floors w/o a crack on the case or phone)before it finally broke 2weeks ago(falling from the couch to the floor)So i think the life span on this case depends on how you handle your phone.
yes would recommend, fun design, little less strong than I would like but for the price, fun change, would buy again

I wanted to highly recommend this seller>I had a slight issue with the product, and they offered a complete refund without having to send the product back:) I fixed the case, so there was no need for the refund. Thanks for being an honest company!!!!!!
Its beautiful and sturdy but the paint chips easily and its a pain to open the case to take out the cellphone. The sleeve is pretty cool and avoids damage to the case, which is a plus.
summary: Pretty Good but a little problematic...

reviewText: this cover makes an old phone look and feel new. I like that I can order covers for little money and snazzy up my phone.

I am very unhappy with the product.  I expected a rubber frame and the whole product is cheap plastic. Also, it does not fit my htc Evo 4g.  Fortunately, I did not pay much, but I do not like losing any money at all. Do not buy this if you have a Virgin Mobile htc Evo 4g with a 3D camera. The slots do not much.

When i recieved it the first time it was white with cute design and i loved it but after a while it got dirty and cracked so i ordered another one same color and design but the background came back as gray.... um not what i ordered. cute but doesnt last long needs shiny film over to last longer.

Upon ordering the Phone Case, I received it timely & when placing it on my phone, I had no problems snapping it together...I love the design on it. When I ordered the same one previously, when receiving it, the background white color was more translucent, which I actually preferred. ~ winddancer57
These are cheap but worked great for my phone. I do drop it a lot. Some of these did break when I dropped my phone but at least my phone Is ok!

I have had my phone for about two years with the cover I purchased from sprint. I have dropped my phone plenty of time through out this time and never had any problems. I put this cover on my phone Thursday night, on Friday morning it fell off my bed, the cover fell off and my screen shattered. I just had to spend $100 for a replacement phone. This cover isn't rubberized as it says and the cover falls off way too easy.
summary: DO NOT buy unless you want to pay for a replacement phone

reviewText: Fits nicely, I'm really enjoying the cover.  It is real nice and pretty. Recommended to everyone! ;) A must buy item.
I LOVE this case! I got it for my samsung galaxy s 4g (although this is for the vibrant) but it fit perfectly. I always get complimented on it.
My brother loves this case . well built and beautiful . I like it so far and will purchase other for gifts.
The color of the case isn't as bright as the pic shows, its more of a duller color, but the case is good quality and fits good. Would buy from this seller again, Fast Shipping!

reviewText: this is the second faceplate for my phone that i've gone through, and i've ordered two more already.  the clips on there don't hold very well.  if you are prone to dropping your phone, like i am, then one good drop and the top plate is broken for good.  so i can either keep buying new ones, or think about a new phone=)
this case lasted me all through the month of december :D its a really pretty color case too :) very sturdy

The case is pretty.Sadly though the packaging isn't original and after ordering one from another seller than went through in only a couple months I don't think I shall be ordering any more speck cases on amazon,The feel of the case isn't as sturdy as an original and the bottom part that covers the charging port already feels like it again won't last long before breaking.This may not be what you're looking for,

reviewText: This case is extremely durable with the combined hardcase and softcase aspects. I have dropped my phone in it, and there was not any damage to my phone. It's snug, so it can be a little bit of a challenge to take off. Overall good product.
So cute and protects phone very well. Just wish you had more styles to choose from. Great for Christmas time!
Speck candyshells have saved my kids' iPhones.  They have dropped their phones numerous times and their phones have not been damaged.

Fun Christmas phone cover. The cover fits well and seems like it offers good protection.  I like this one so much that I ordered another Speck CandyShell for use after Christmas.  It is a pretty green color.
I agree that it is a little hard to take off, but overall it is a very good case, made with great material, my best purchase on amazon yet.

Wanted a way to charge a spare battery. This charger does that, but none of the batteries I charge on it seem to last as long as when I charge them on the Motorola Charger. Theoretically, 1860mAh should last longer than 1700mAh but doesn't.

Charger and batteries do work but there is no way the batteries are really 1860 mAh.  These batteries last less than half as long as the stock one which is rated less. This holds true whether charged in the phone or the external charger.  I will keep the charger and buy better batteries now. Seller should be taken off this website IMO.
I bought this for my best friends birthday & she loves it!! She never takes it off her phone!! Also the price was great & the shipping was quick!!
i love this case! the print is great and the pink is slightly darker than the picture but its nice. it fits the phone great and is on real tight but removes easily.
fits very the phone very well, superb design and  looks great on the phone, very eye catching and classy..good job
the case was some what scratched and the case wouldnt shut all the way. But overall it was okay! thanks

The case is very colorful, amd fits the phone nicely.  My wife is getting a new phone soon, so I bought it even though the reviews said the color peels off easily.  That is true.  My wife hasn't had it very long, and there is already a huge silver spot where the color came off. For the price it's great but it won't be pretty very long.
Cute, but the leopard peels off fast. It only lasted a month.  I keep good care of my electronics, and it was never just thrown in my purse.  Not worth the money.

This case is fairly nice.  It is a hard case but has a rubberized coating on it for better grip, feel.  My daughter carries it in her purse and I have noticed that the coating has started to wear off in a couple of spots.

I love the color and the texture. Plus, got it at a great price compared to the mall kiosks. The only thing i could see wrong with it is that after a few months the pattern started to peel off the cover and the snaps come lose every so often. Other than that loved it!
It fits well i would order again from you and tell others that have the same phone as me  .By
I haven't used this case yet, but it looks like the picture and I can't wait to use this one next.
This case is very cute. I purchased several of them and just loved the color and style. Thank you very much.
I liked this I love cheetah and I love pink. I wish it would have been brighter and I wish it was more of a shine to it. but I still liked it

This cell phone case is so much better than I expected! I love the hard rubber texture and not to mention the design! It came with a screen protector. I put it on on and you cant even tell its there. Easy to put on! Also came with the film to clean the screen and the bag it came in keeps my phone safe while in my purse. I just love this item all around!!! Great value for all you get!! Shipping was super fast! It came the next day!
Loved this phone case. Very cute and looks just as it is shown.Would recommend this case to anyone. with a samsung

The 1st word on this case's description says, "Rubberized".  I thought it would be a hard gel since it also stated it was "Hard".  Nope.  It's a cute case, but being hard makes it unlikely to absorb shock if the phone is dropped.

reviewText: Very unhappy with this product!  Huge split down length of phone within a week of owning without even dropping it.  I have accidentally dropped it since and all 3 pieces flew off the phone - fortunately no damage to my phone however more and more cracks and chips have occurred.  The back barely sticks onto the front now- need to replace it already. Pretty sure Kate Spade would not want her name on this product!

I received the  case well on time. Unlike what past reviewers have said, the case may be silicon, but it is a hard case and is exactly what I was looking for. Also I was thrilled to find that there was a screen protector included in the order. Thanks very much. Great job, will use again.

i love giraffes and my new iphone 4 and couldn't wait to get my new phone case in the mail, but quite frankly, THIS PRODUCT SUCKS!!!  i received it today and immediately went to put it on my phone, only to find that it was a bit tough to actually fit onto the phone.  fortunately it is somewhat flexible, even though it is hard plastic, so i was able to get it on, but then i checked all the holes for the camera, charging connection, etc, and i found that the ring/silent button could barely be accessed-- i had to use my fingernail inside of the hole to slide the button.  i was thinking of just settling, since i don't ever use this button, but then i noticed that the case was not clearing the down volume button, so little so that it was half depressed and the volume was stuck at it's lowest!  i tried sliding the phone around inside the case, thinking maybe it was crooked, but it didn't budge.  and when i went to take the case off my phone, it took me almost 5 minutes to get it off, because it is so small that the phone was really wedged in!  this case is definitely going back, ASAP!!  why would i pay 20 bucks for a piece of garbage?!
summary: too bad you can't give zero stars-- this thing sucks!!

reviewText: I am not sure of the authenticity of this item.  I have the pink dot case that I bought at the New York Kate Spade store, so I can compare the stamping and quality.  This one was not the same quality, and I'm not certain it was authentic. It broke within 2 days. Disappointed.

I was expecting this case to have the green sides instead of the pink. Maybe a picture of this or info in description would be beneficial. Packaging was ripped at all corners- like someone had taken the case out of the box. This was disappointing as it was a gift, but the case itself was fine.

I'm very disappointed in the quality of this phone cover. I've only had it for a few weeks and it falls apart very easily. I dropped my phone off the coffee table (2 feet high) and the case fell completely apart and does this consistently when picking up the phone.  Also, from the picture it does not show that the case is pink on the side...deceiving. If I could I would return this item and want a full refund.

I bought this because I thought I was getting a deal, I should have just purchased the full price, real Kate Spade case for $10 more!  Not only was this a bad knock-off, but it the side was PINK, not as advertised.  I would like a full refund!  What a frustration.

I searched forever for what I thought was the Kate Spade gold dots iphone case with black sides, but when it came it was pink. I am extremely disappointed and would never recommend buying from this supplier.
summary: Very Disappointing - Pink Sides, not Black!!!!

reviewText: Grate design, I get lots of comments about it. The Case is sturdy and durable, it's also Easy to clean.

Within 1 week of careful teenager use (was not dropped), a piece of this case cracked off.  It is not protective at all, just fashionable.  I wouldn't recommend it at all, especially at this price.  Now my daughter has learned that she must read the reviews prior to purchasing anything.  I always find them helpful.

This case is cute, but chipped after the 2nd week I used it.  The corner chipped as I was trying to remove the case from my phone.  By the 3rd week the chip got even worse & actual pieces came off from the same corner from everyday use.  The entire case is made of thin cheap plastic material that would break if someone touched it slightly.  For the amount of money Kate Spade charges for her cases, they should be made of a more quality durable plastic.  Save your money & buy another brand!
Not enough credit card slots but beautifully made.  Matches my cell case. Always gets compliments. Its a glossy brown case not black.
This is a pretty cell phone case. I love all my cell phone cases. Thanks very very much for it.
Do not buy this item! All of the gems fell off very fast I had another before this and those fell off as well but not as fast as this one!
For the price awesome...over time and use some of the stones came out but nothing real noticably...I'd rather pay this than the price at the malls...

I love the design and the price was great, but the moment I make a phone call with this on my phone my screen goes black and will not light back up until I pop the case off, so I cannot end the call until I do that. Not fun. Obviously there is something wrong with the opening at the very top that is affecting the sensors on the phone.I also ordered another similar case around the same time and have been pretty happy with that one as it does not cause my phone to malfunction.

reviewText: cute. but way too bulky and it covers the speaker on my phone!! And also the gems make it hard 2 have a long conversation because they dig in your ear! =( But if you want a durable one this is it!

I bought this and it almost immidiately broke on me, two days after i got it the back started falling off because the snaps that held it in place broke. looked good though, im glad i didn't spend more money on it,
Looks good and gets positive feedback. It's not very hard mental and dents easily however. It's clearly not OEM but it's a fun accessory for your phone and for your Porsche.

I bought these covers without realizing that the Porsche emblem on the back was raised up quite a bit from the surface. You cannot lay the phone down  without scratching the surface and I would assume that the badge will eventually fall off or catch on something and get pulled off. As I said, looks really cool but is certainly not practical. For the price that I paid, it would be a good once off party piece and that is about it.
The phone cover looks great, and offers good protection for my phone.  It fits snugly and allows full access to the functional buttons.  No complaints!
Great look, BUT, everything else feels cheap, a product of forced maximum labor from china. The product description says hard metal,however in reality it is otherwise,no more!
If you want this your not getting anywhere near a pink or hot pink iphone back glass i got this and it came and was purple

Only a couple bucks, this charger does it's thing...  AND LASTS!!!  I've had this product for a few months now and it still works wonderfully!  I'd recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to spend the $50 on a regular charger with all the bells and whistles.  This is an innexpensive yet very effective alternative!

These chargers are typically inexpensive and unreliable, but this one worked consistently without freezing or locking up the phone (in the past I have had to unplug devices before using them or risk freezing them).

No need to review other products on the web. This is the Best on the Market! Over the last couple of years I have tried many charging devices, most don't work on the iPod even when they say they will. This one really does!It also has a capacity of 5000mAh which is almost 4 times other units. The top selling Richard Solo at $40.00 is only rated at 1200mAh!This unit is well constructed and looks very high quality. My wife gave it to me as a Xmas gift and I have charged everything I have tried. My iPod Touch (twice), my Blackberry, and even my Golf GPS unit. All charged without any problems! AND the unit still shows mid range charge remaining! It comes with an interchangeable tip USB cable and a very nice case to hold everything. However I found it will work with any USB cable I tried including my wife's odd connector type cell phone.Exceptional unit! I just had to order a second unit for my wife.

this package stands out from the rest of the sellers who sell similar product of imp500, because it offers most complete accessories with imp500 - mini USB/micro USB will cover most of popular mobile devices (major smart phones from blackberry, palm, t-mobile, htc etc) plus gps devices and with a free fast universal AC charger. one of unique offers is the carry bag for holding all the imp500 and its accessories together in one single bag, so you are ready to go to hit the road and never worry about losing your accessories for imp500. and all of these come with same price $59.95 or less, who can beat this deal?!

reviewText: Whats to be said, the quality and delivery of this product is simply awesome.  I actually tested the claims on my iPhone 3G.21 hr video playback with all ancillary toggs on (3G, WiFi, volume, etc...)4 full recharges from 0-100Unit out of the box charges in 4 hrs.From 0-100 6 hrs.It works and well worth the price.  BUY IT NOW!
i am pleased with the product except the image is stretched besides that its fine (i needed five more words)

I loved the black and pink leopard print, very cute. Quality was OK, especially considering the cheap price. The cover started to chip after a few months of use. But overall, i was happy with my purchase.
Simple to install and a great way to help protect your phone.My wife really liked the ability to change the look of her phone.
I love this case. It is so cute and I have got tons of compliments on it. The rubber grip keeps it from slipping.

The case is pretty good. It dose have some scratches on one side of the phone but its every little. Other then that i like it. reviewText: I really like this phone cover. It fits the phone perfect and I love the colors. I would recommend to anyone.

very cheap looking. You can see the white through the pink and black. Scratches easy. Not something I would buy again.

i love the way it looks on my phone and it definitely helps to protect my phone when it falls on the ground

I order this case on November 7 and its december 23 this case was suppose to be a christmas gift for a loved one and now its not, I want to know why in the hell my order isn't here yet!!!

This case is really fun and i love the texture(some what of a rubber glove feel). I only had it for a a few days before my niece had to have it for her phone and she is also in love with it. gives a nice all over protection without having the phone to over heat like some other cases
i had this case for like two weeks, and the "paint" or whatever is already coming off. My entire case is practically white. At first i was really excieted, becuase look at this thing, its so cute!

reviewText: I liked the way it looked in the picture, but when I received it, the quality is as bad as if someone spray painted the design on. Around the sides the paint is faded and rubbed off and I haven't even opened it.
Product looks exactly like shown. It started peeling within two weeks. I got what I paid for. I feel content with the purchase but not confident to reorder from this buyer.
This lasted longer than the phone did! Paint will scratch easily though. Not a ton... but you definitely see how much you put your phone through in a day!

I have had this phone cover for several months now. As far as protection goes, I would say it's ok. I have dropped my phone several times. My phone has not been broken, so that's why I say this is okay protection. I realize that most people may not be as clumsy as me, but whatever, I can't change that. This is my truest review of the product after owning it for about half a year, clumsiness and all. When I drop my phone the case breaks apart. Which is fine, it always snaps back together, it just stinks because then my phone does still get scratched from the fall. However, the screen hasn't broken yet etc, etc. The colors of this case rub off. The sides especially are practically plain silver now, and also some areas on the back of the case has worn down to silver. reviewText: This charger doesn't work with a Motorola V188.  The charger has a mini-USB plug, but the V188 phone needs a round concentric plug.  The V188 does have a mini-USB connector, but it's only for data (ringtones and such).  The charger doesn't do anything when you plug it in.It works fine with my Motorola Q and my GPS, so I'm keeping it as a spare.  The price was good, so it isn't worth the hassle of returning it.I'd give it 5 stars if I'd bought it for a device that charges over a mini-USB port, but it was advertised to work with the V188 and that was what I bought it for.
The charger sent was not the one requested. It does not fit the Samsung model A157. Purchased correct one from another source.
The item worked as advertised.  I am always leery of electronics, but this item  really works well.  Thanks for supplying a great product at a reasonable price.

I ordered this since we needed one charger for the car the new a777 phones from ATT don't fit the charger we had.  I really wish the cell phone companies would standardizeo the ports for the chargers, especially since the difference between our old and new one was so slight but just enough to make us buy a new one.  The ATT store wanted about $20.00 for a charger, but this was such a great buy.  It came as described and fits and works great.  I will continue to check Amazon for tech gear like this since the landscape changes so fast and the aftermarket price for accessories varies so much.
I have a Samsung a777.  This fits perfect, charges great and seems sturdy!  Only one thing, the cord is a bit short for a car cable in my opinion.  Otherwise works great!
Best service, great product. Its inexpensive and use it all the time while on the road....practical and safe to use.

I've had mixed results with ordering replacement chargers for our growing pile of electronic gadgets. This one worked on arrival, it works now, several weeks later, and hopefully it will last at least a year, which would be a record in this house. Unknown brands (cheap) have performed miserably, so that's why I chose a Samsung OEM product for my Samsung phone. I'll update if I have any negative experience to report.
All I can say is that it came in perfect condition and it was just what I was looking for.  Glad I ordered it from Amazon; best prices.

reviewText: Just as described. Works consistently. It was easy to find just what I was looking for! I will be shopping on this site for all our electronic accessories.

I placed 2 orders for three chargers and the order with one charger came in fast and correct. The other order with 2 chargers was fast but incorrect. I sent BestBuyCell an email that day and the following day I had a tracking number for the correct order and received it within a few days. I recommend BestBuyCell, it was hassle free and fast to get my order fixed.As for the chargers, they work great with my bionic unlike the stock one, or the ones Verizon sells (which cause touch screen problems)  they are Motorola branded and charge very fast, while other cheap chargers take twice as long to charge or longer.

The device came quickly, but it did not fit the Droid. I sent this review about a week ago and have received no response, except for this request to review again. The review doesn't seem to do much for the customer.I could not give zero stars.

The picture is not an accurate representation of what you will be receiving! Looks like an old version that came with the regular flip phones to me. Also BOTH of the chargers I ordered would not even charge my phone at all! Don't waste your time and money. Going through filing a claim right now.

Charger works well, although it's a tight fit at the connection to my droid. The charger does not allow you to connect the droid to your computer but it's perfect as a 2nd charger. The cord is also longer than the one that comes with the phone so it gives more flexibility if you want to use the phone while it's charging. Excellent value for the price.
The product is not the one pictured.  However, it is a genuine Motorola product and the cord is pretty long.  Great price for this product.
Love the extra long cord!! Product does what it is suppose to do. Used with my Droid X. Would buy again.
I was a little suspicious about whether I was actually getting an OEM charger, but it was.  It charges so much faster than the non-OEM charger I had ordered previously.  I got the item quickly.

You get what you pay for!!  On several Android Forums people have posted that non-OEM chargers cause their Droids to go crazy, black out their screens, and cause the phone to get locked up.  This charger works perfectly.  Don't hesitate to buy this charger!

I ordered 2 of these charger chords. The one works well but I will say that it doesn't charge my phone as quickly as the original one that came with the phone. Regardless, that's ok.The second one I ordered (I ordered 2 from the same supplier at the same time IN THE SAME ORDER) is the complete wrong chord. It doesn't fit my phone.
I got this charger for my boyfriend and within a week, the charger didn't work anymore. He has a droid 2. Don't buy this product.

I bought a couple of these chargers because they have a much longer cable to plug into a wall outlet or power strip.The micro USB adapter is so much narrower and flimsy than the much shorter data USB cable adapter with detachable electric plug.Less than 18 months later, both of them cannot maintain contact to the Droid 4 jack in order to charge the phone.  Much less convenient to use data cable charger plugged into electrical outlet or power strip which are generally lower than accomodating surface on which to set phone.
summary: Stopped Working, Too Loose to Maintain Charge

reviewText: This adapter fit my Droid phone perfectly, and the cord is luxuriously long! This is a better adapter then the many i have purchased from Verizon. The $30 Verizon chargers seem to stop working after a month or two, and the cords are only 3 feet long making them very inconvenient. Highly recommended.
Actual Motorola charger. Looks like the charger I got with my phone... and works great. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

This is a great choice for a second charger for a Motorola Droid.  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for an additional charger for their Droid.  The cord length is much longer than the original charger which is nice when using in an office or hotel.  Though the description says Mid-rate charger - I did not notice any difference in charging time between this charger and the original one.  As with the original charger, the charging feature is disabled when the battery is 100% charged.  Good charger for the price!
This motorola car charger was made for my Motorola cell phone an works very well. What I like best it does not have the (10) different adaptors with it in order to make it connect to my phone.

If you enjoy plugging things into the cigarette lighter of your car or truck then you are going to love this. It looks kind of cool - like maybe it shoots out some kind of death ray or at least has an option to set it to stun but what it is most useful for is charging my Droid, which is always out of friggin' batteries.We are living in a material world and Gadgets are cool. Gadgets need juice and they don't run on manjuice. This thing works and it has blue M. Really, when pondering life and all of its wonder, isn't that all you need?

I was skeptical at first to order as there are numerous false listing of "OEM" products....however, this is the REAL thing.  I am glad to get it at the price I did versus being overcharged at a Verizon store!

I purchased this item last December from an Amazon reseller for my then-new Motorola Droid Android OS cellphone. I paid twice the price, which was still $10 cheaper than Verizon's own generic phone charger. This unit is OEM Motorola, solidly constructed, unlikely to fall apart like many other car phone chargers. It glows a pleasant soft blue when plugged into your 12VDC car jack. It charges my phone on the way home from work each evening (I leave it plugged in overnight at home). That is sufficient to power it for a whole day of heavy use and then until I retire for the day. How can you go wrong at the current price, 50% less than just 3 months ago?
It works. 13 no 11 more words to say its a car charger that works as I expected it to.
Charges well and looks good.  The LED is a bit bright, so at night you may finding yourself repositioning the charger so that it doesn't shine towards you.

Simple enough: Product does what it's supposed to do -- that is, it safely and quickly charges my Droid X -- and the price here is much, much better than buying it through Verizon. Really, it's a no-brainer. If you need a car charger for your Droid X, this is the right item at the right price.
summary: Great price, does what it's supposed to do

reviewText: Its cheap, it looks cool, and it charges my phone in a reasonable amount of time....I mean you cannot really go wrong with this for the price.... so don't worry too much about researching 10 more products like this and waste your time, make sure you buy at least a couple, well you know one for each of your cars...

I was very pleased and it arrived just in time, due to my old adaptor shorted out. I would buy from them again.

This unit works just fine and has held up for 4 years.We use Amazon for most of our purchases and I update my reviews if anything changes with the products. Still, we charged the phone a couple of times and it seemed to work okay. In theory, I think that lower amps means that it should take longer to charge, but we usually leave it charging overnight anyway, plus this is just a backup to use if the original one gets lost or broken, so it's no big deal.

When my old charger finally gave out, Verizon  wanted $39.95 for as new one.  I bought two of these for less than $10.  This one works fine and is actually smaller than the original which is great for traveling.
summary: An economical alternative to Verizon's high price

I have really enjoyed using this device and love the retractable cord.  Met my expectations and would recommend to others.

Before a recent 3,000 car trip, I forgot to order a 12-volt car charger for my Nokia N97.  Fortunately, I did have a 120-volt Nokia N97 charger in my laptop bag, and had a 12-volt to 120-volt converter for my netbook, so I was able to get by.  [Finding a Nokia N97 charger, with the almost proprietary USB style connector at Radio Shack or Walmart is not going to happen].When I returned from the trip, I ordered a "no name" aftermarket 12-volt charger for the phone.  It turned out to be unreliable.  That was a wasted $7.I went back to Amazon, and bought this official Nokia charger for about $10 more than the aftermarket chargers.  I was kicking myself for initially "saving" $10 for a no-name charger for my very expensive phone.  What if it had damaged the phone?  I had spent a lot of money for a very high end phone, and then risked killing it by using a $10 cheaper charger.  Where's the logic in that?  Why risk your $600 phone by using a $7 charger, when the official Nokia charger is just $10 more. D'oh!This charger works as it should.  It charges the phone quickly, doesn't do anything weird to the car radio, and doesn't get hot.  The peace of mind, knowing that it isn't likely to damage the phone, or start a fire in the car, is worth far more than the extra $10 cost.  I wouldn't know about doing a technical review of this charger.  Somewhere, I read that there's a microchip logic in the charger.  If so, that could have been the problem with the cheap charger. This one works very well, doing what it's supposed to do.  I didn't give it 5 stars because Nokia is almost certainly overcharging...(Get it? Overcharging?)for this item.
summary: More Expensive, but Peace of Mind

reviewText: I bought this thinking it would be the same quality as an "official" Samsung car charger, but it most definitely isn't. My charger worked fine for about 2 months. Between regular usage on my Samsung Epic and letting people in the car with the same port plug in their phone, the charger no longer works properly. In the beginning, I could talk on the phone or have it in any position while charging. Over the 2 months the charger started getting more particular about what position it could be charged in. As of the review it only works with the phone in a horizontal position on my center console. The blue LED status light does let me know when it's charging or not, but this is small consolation when I have a near dead battery and a call comes in. From outside appearances the charger appears fine, but either the wiring near the phone port connector is weakened or the port connector itself is faulty. I have since tested other chargers on my phone and they work fine so it is not a phone or car power outlet problem. If I was stuck somewhere with a dead battery and the price was at or near $5 as it is here, I would buy this. So, other than for emergency or a cheap backup I would spring for something better.Pros- Price. You can't beat the at or near $5 price. Can leave charger plugged even when not in use.Cons- Poorly made. Cord is too short. Great in a pinch only. Will more than likely not function in a few monthsP.S. Another recommendation would be to only use your charger on your phone or the same model. Even though the ports are supposed to be universal, I believe it helped speed up my charger being finicky. Your friends and family may hate you for being "stingy" with your charger but at least it has a better chance of working for your phone later. Besides, they don't really need their phone when they're with you, all their attention should be on you...Lol

I never took it out of the socket, and I only ever charged my phone on it for about 45 minutes at a time.
This item did not fit properly into my lighter slot, the second time I used it.  I then threw it out.  You get what you pay for.
For the price - cheap - this charger is fine. It's a little slow, but when I'm using it on a 6-hour trip, that hardly matters.
My grandson lost the wall charger for his cell phone and we couldn't find one anywhere in a store.  This item was delivered on time and works really well.
This was the best price I could find to replace my lost cell phone charger.The folding blades is a nice feature when packing for travel.The mini USB fits perfectly, not too loose.

This is a great charger for my EVO HTC and my husband uses for his EVO 3d!  Plugs easily into wall while folding if you want to take with you!  I love the extra long cord as you know the cords for these phones are so short and this one is just the perfect length!!  No more bending over to use phone while charging!  I love it!!

It's a usefull item, really usefull. I use the gps function of my samsung galaxy ace frequently and do the fact that this phone drain a lot of battery this item becomes really a good help to keep phone working. Thank a lot
lasted about 2 mths, then it started to become looser in the connection where u plug it in.then wires started to come loose, just spend the 15. and by a named brand one.
This product works great.  I bought it for my Samsung Prevail and it chargers quickly.  It was the original samsung car charger so no worries it would damage my phone.
Great product; if my phone is running low, I can always quickly charge it up while I'm driving around.
This charger works well for my Galaxy s2 phone. It allows me to charge my phone while on the go.
Excelente producto.  Lo compré para cargar en mi carro mi Samsung Galaxy S2  y carga perfectamente el teléfono.  Vendedor y producto 100% recomendado.
This product arrived on time and works great. I would recommend this product to family and friends. Great buy for your money.

It does not work 99% of the time, and when it appears to be working the battery still drains.Total waste of money and really makes me understand the meaning of "you get what you pay for." Make yourself a favor and spend a few more bucks on a better one.
The charger works great! No problems whatsoever. Charges very quickly and the charger is structurally well built. Excellent, would definitely recommend.
It works great  thus  far no issues.  The only thing i might have limited was a usb Connect or it charges my t989 without fail

reviewText: The price was awesome but the charger only worked for a few weeks with very little use. I assume a "get what you pay for" comes into play. My bad. Not too big of a loss at all so not turned off on the seller, would try another purchase in the future...just not a charger.

reviewText: It worked like a charm the first two weeks (approximately). Then it just stopped charging my phone. I tried it in two cars and even when turned off, my phone doesn't charge. Not worth it. Would not recommend.

I bought another charger for my Samsung Galaxy SII Skyrocket that CLAIMED it worked for my phone and the POS didnt. As you know the Android phones hold no battery life whatsoever so it's imperative that I have a car charger. This one works great and charges the phone fairly quickly. I have no complaints!

I bought two of these chargers and they both were defective. One of them arrived defective - the part that connects to the accessory socket in the car was sunken in. The other one connected to the phone and acted like it was charging (the phone would vibrate and the battery meter had the little lightning bolt) but the battery kept draining. This is very disappointing, considering these are actual Samsung chargers and we were using Galaxy S2 phones with them. Fortunately, we were able to return them for a refund.

This charger was exactly what it said in the description.  It arrived before the date that Amazon promised when I ordered and included a nice note from the company asking me to contact them if there were any problems. It is working fine with a good tight fit to the phone. Very satisfied.
This product lasted about 3 weeks before it packed up. Besides charging shut down a couple of time due to "high voltage". Would not recommend it

I got this charger and when connected my phone indicates a charging state.  However as time passes, the charge percentage drops indicating it is NOT working.  My guess is it's a counterfeit Samsung device, and the old credo "you get what you pay for" applies.  I'll pay AT&T their outlandish rate for a charger that actually works.

Ordered this car charger and it did not charge my Samsung Galaxay S2. This charger made my phone feel like it was going to catch on fire my battery was so hot.  I was sent a replacement and it did the same thing.

The big store that is in every town now (can't say their name) either does not carry anything or is always out of stock. If they ever have anything is stock, it is cheap junk that does not last. I got this cord thru amazon for a fraction of the price I usually pay for the junk at that big national store. This cord works perfectly and has lasted for months now. I also bought at the same time 2 other cheaper charger cords thru amazon that work perfectly. Since this one still works, I have the other two to fall back on when this one finally goes out. This is a great car charger, and it does not cost near as much as the junk you get at the local store--not to mention this is the Samsung brand charger verses their junk.

This item does not work good at all. I bought two, one for my Trailblazer and one for my husband's big truck (18 wheeler).  They do not plug in good in the device in the vehicles so they do not charge either of our phones.  I would not recommend this charger to no one.
